chapter.title: Compute API v2 extensions (SUPPORTED)
chapter.para: Extensions add features, MIME types, actions, states, headers, parameters, and resources to the core Compute API without requiring a version change.

note.para: Effective in the OpenStack Kilo release, XML support in requests and responses was removed for the Compute API v2.
The Compute API returns the 403 forbidden error code if you exceed your allotted quota for the operation.

section.title: Servers with block device mapping format (servers)
section.para: Creates a server with a block device mapping.

section.title: Servers with configuration drive (servers)
section.para: Extends servers and images with a configuration drive.

section.title: Servers console (servers)
section.para: Gets a console for a server instance.

section.title: Servers console output (servers)
section.para: Gets console output for a server instance.

section.title: Servers extended attributes (servers)
section.para: Shows metadata for servers.

section.title: Servers with extended availability zones (servers)
section.para: Shows the instance availability zone for compute nodes (nova- compute). Internal services appear in their own internal availability zone.

section.title: Servers extended status (servers)
section.para: Shows the vm_state, task_state, and power_state extended status information in detailed server responses.

section.title: Servers with IP type (servers)
section.para: Shows the type of the IP addresses that are assigned to an instance. Type is either fixed or floating.

section.title: Servers multiple create (servers)
section.para: Creates one or more servers with an optional reservation ID. The request and response examples show how to create multiple servers with or without a reservation ID.

section.title: Servers with mac_addr extended attribute (servers)
section.para: Creates, shows information for, and lists servers with the mac_addr extended attribute.

section.title: Servers with scheduler hints (servers)
section.para: Creates a server with scheduler hints.

section.title: Servers administrative actions (servers, action)
section.para: Administrator only. Performs actions on a server. Specify the action in the request body.

section.title: Servers deferred delete (servers, action)
section.para: Force-deletes a server and restores a deleted server.

section.title: Servers rescue and unrescue (servers, action)
section.para: Puts a server into rescue mode and unrescues a server in rescue mode.

section.title: Servers shelve (servers, action)
section.para: Shelves servers, restores shelved servers, and removes shelved servers.

Shelving is useful when you have an unused instance that you would like to keep for later use. For example, at the end of a work week you can shelve an instance and at the start of the next week you can unshelve it.
Your cloud provider might bill you for a shelved server.
Use the shelve action to shelve a server. All associated data and resources are kept but anything still in memory is not retained.
Use the unshelve action to restore a shelved instance.
Use the shelveOffload action to remove a shelved instance that you no longer need.

section.title: Servers start and stop (servers, action)
section.para: Starts a stopped server and stops a running server.

section.title: Servers diagnostics (servers, diagnostics)
section.para: Gets the usage data for a server.

section.title: Servers and images with disk config (servers, images)
section.para: Extends servers with the diskConfig attribute.

section.title: Servers availability zones (servers, os-availability-zone)
section.para: Gets availability zone information.

section.title: Servers instance actions (servers, os-instance-actions)
section.para: Lists available actions for a specified server. Administrators can get details for a specified action for a specified server.

section.title: Servers password (servers, os-server-password)
section.para: Gets and resets the encrypted administrative password set through the metadata service.

section.title: Servers virtual interfaces (servers, os-virtual-interfaces)
section.para: Lists the virtual interfaces for a specified server instance.

section.title: Servers with volume attachments (servers, os-volume_attachments)
section.para: Attaches volumes that are created through the volume API to server instances. Also, lists volume attachments for a server instance, gets volume details for a volume attachment, and detaches a volume.

section.title: Server boot from volume (os-volumes_boot)
section.para: Starts an instance by using a volume with the bootable attribute. The image on the volume is used to boot the instance.

section.title: Flavors create and delete (flavors)
section.para: Creates, lists, and deletes flavors.

section.title: Flavors with disabled attribute (flavors)
section.para: Lists and gets details for flavors. Includes the disabled extended attribute.

section.title: Flavors with extended attributes (flavors)
section.para: Creates, gets details for, and lists details for flavors. Includes the rxtx_factor, OS-FLV-EXT-DATA:ephemeral, and swap extended attributes.

section.title: Flavors with rxtx_factor extended attribute (flavors)
section.para: Creates, gets details for, and lists details for flavors. Includes the rxtx_factor extended attribute, which is related to configured bandwidth cap values.

section.title: Flavors with extra-specs (flavors, os-extra-specs)
section.para: Lists, creates, and updates the extra-specs or keys for a flavor.

section.title: Flavors access (flavors, os-flavor-access)
section.para: Creates and gets details for private flavors. Also, lists, adds, and removes tenants' access to private flavors.

section.title: Flavors swap (flavors, os-flavor-swap)
section.para: Creates and lists flavors with a swap value. Requires the os-flavormanage extension. The swap value is the amount of swap disk space, in GBs, to allocate to a server.

section.title: Images with size attribute (images)
section.para: Lists details for available images and gets details for a specified image. Includes the OS-EXT-IMG-SIZE:size extended attribute, which shows the image size.

section.title: Limits with project usage (limits)
section.para: Extends limits to show the project usage. Shows information such as RAM and instance quotas usage.

section.title: Limits with project usage for administrators (limits)
section.para: Extends limits to enable administrators to show the project usage for a specified customer project ID. Shows information such as RAM and instance quotas usage.

section.title: Guest agents (os-agents)
section.para: Creates, updates, and deletes guest agents.

Use guest agents to access files on the disk, configure networking, and run other applications and scripts in the guest while it runs. This hypervisor-specific extension is not currently enabled for KVM. Use of guest agents is possible only if the underlying service provider uses the Xen driver.

section.title: Host aggregates (os-aggregates)
section.para: Creates and manages host aggregates. An aggregate assigns metadata to groups of compute nodes. Aggregates are only visible to the cloud provider.

section.title: Bare metal nodes (os-baremetal-nodes)
section.para: Bare metal nodes.

section.title: Root certificates (os-certificates)
section.para: Creates and shows details for a root certificate.

section.title: Cloudpipe (os-cloudpipe)
section.para: Manages virtual VPNs for projects.

section.title: Coverage reports (os-coverage)
section.para: Shows coverage reports.

section.title: Network extended attributes (os-extended-networks)
section.para: Creates, shows details for, and lists networks with extended attributes.

section.title: Fixed IPs (os-fixed-ips)
section.para: Shows data for a specified fixed IP, such as host name, CIDR, and address. Also, reserves and frees a fixed IP address.

section.title: Floating IP DNS records (os-floating-ip-dns)
section.para: Manages DNS records that are associated with IP addresses that are allocated by the floating IPs extension. Requests are dispatched to a DNS driver selected at startup.

section.title: Floating IP pools (os-floating-ip-pools)
section.para: Manages groups of floating IPs.

section.title: Floating IPs (os-floating-ips)
section.para: Assigns and allocates floating IP addresses to instances that run in an OpenStack cloud.

section.title: Floating IPs bulk (os-floating-ips-bulk)
section.para: Bulk-creates, deletes, and lists floating IPs. By default, the pool is named nova. Use the os-floating-ip-pools extension to view available pools.

section.title: Hosts (os-hosts)
section.para: Manages physical hosts.

section.title: Hypervisors (os-hypervisors)
section.para: Displays extra statistical information from the machine that hosts the hypervisor through the API for the hypervisor (XenAPI or KVM/libvirt).

section.title: Hypervisor with status (os-hypervisor-status)
section.para: Displays extra statistical information including status from the machine that hosts the hypervisor through the API for the hypervisor (XenAPI or KVM/libvirt).

section.title: Attach interfaces (os-interface)
section.para: Creates, lists, gets details for, and deletes port interfaces.

section.title: Keypairs (os-keypairs)
section.para: Generates, imports, and deletes SSH keys.
To add a keypair to a server, specify the key_name parameter in the request body in a create server request.

section.title: Migrations (os-migrations)
section.para: Administrators only. Gets in-progress migrations for a region or specified cell in a region.

section.title: Networks (os-networks)
section.para: Shows network information for and deletes networks. Also, disassociates a network from a project in VLAN mode.

section.title: Quota class (os-quota-class-sets)
section.para: Provides quota classes management support.

section.title: Quota sets (os-quota-sets)
section.para: Administrators only, depending on policy settings.
Shows quotas for a tenant and shows and updates default quotas.

section.title: Security groups (os-security-groups)
section.para: Lists, lists by server, creates, shows information for, updates, and deletes security groups.

section.title: Rules for security group (os-security-group-rules)
section.para: Creates and deletes security group rules.

section.title: Rules for default security group (os-security-group-default-rules)
section.para: Lists, shows information for, and creates default security group rules.

section.title: Server groups (os-server-groups)
section.para: Lists, shows information for, creates, and deletes server groups.

section.title: Manage services (os-services)
section.para: Lists, enables, and disables Compute services in all hosts.

section.title: Usage reports (os-simple-tenant-usage)
section.para: Reports usage statistics on compute and storage resources.

section.title: Volume extension (os-volumes, os-snapshots)
section.para: Manages volumes and snapshots for use with the Compute API.
